sen.j: 孝子内親王（たかこないしんのう、慶安3年10月11日 (旧暦)（1650年11月4日） - 享保10年6月26日 (旧暦)（1725年8月4日）は、江戸時代の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Takako (November 4, 1650 - August 4, 1725) was a member of the Imperial family during the Edo period.
Imperial Princess Takako (November 4, 1650 - August 4, 1725) was a member of the Imperial family during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: Imperial family→Imperial Family と修正しました。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Takako (November 4, 1650 - August 4, 1725) was a member of the Imperial family during the Edo period.

sen.j: 後光明天皇の第一皇女。
sen.e: She was the first Princess of Emperor Gokomyo.
She was the first princess of the Emperor Gokomyo.
sen.cmt: Princess→princess と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: She was the first princess of the Emperor Gokomyo.

sen.j: 生母は近衛府庭田重秀の女、典侍庭田秀子。
sen.e: Her real mother was Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) Hideko NIWATA, a daughter of Shigehide NIWATA in Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).
Her real mother was Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) Hideko NIWATA, a daughter of Shigehide NIWATA of Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).
Her real mother was Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) Hideko NIWATA, a daughter of Shigehide NIWATA of Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 慶安3年（1650年）、後光明天皇の第一皇女として誕生。
sen.e: In 1650, she was born the first Princess of Emperor Gokomyo.
In 1650, she was born as the first princess of the Emperor Gokomyo.
sen.cmt: as, the を補いました。Princess→princess と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1650, she was born as the first princess of the Emperor Gokomyo.
She was called Onna Ichinomiya.
She was called Onna Ichinomiya.
She was called Onna Ichinomiya.

sen.j: 誕生日については10月10日、10月11日、10月15日とするものがある。
sen.e: There are several stories about her birthday: November 3, 4 and 8.
There are different dates as her birthday: November 3, 4 and 8.
sen.cmt: several stories about→different dates as と修正しました。
sen.e: There are different dates as her birthday: November 3, 4 and 8.

sen.j: 承応3年（1654年）、父後光明天皇が22歳の若さで崩御。
sen.e: In 1654, her father Emperor Gokomyo died young at the age of 22.
In 1654, her father the Emperor Gokomyo died young at the age of 22.
In 1654, her father the Emperor Gokomyo died young at the age of 22.

sen.j: しかし天皇の子女は孝子内親王のみで皇嗣たる男子がなかったため、急遽異母弟の高貴宮（識仁親王、のちの霊元天皇）を皇嗣とし、高貴宮が成長するまでの中継ぎとして同じく異母弟の花町宮良仁親王が後西天皇として即位した。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Takako was the Emperor's only one child and there was no Crown Prince, and so his younger paternal half-brother Ade no Miya (Imperial Prince Satohito, later Emperor Reigen) hastily became Crown Prince while his another younger paternal half-brother Hanamachi no Miya (Imperial Prince Nagahito) ascended the throne as Emperor Gosai, a relay successor for the time being until Ade no Miya matured.

The Imperial Princess Takako was the Emperor's only child and there was no crown prince, and so his younger paternal half-brother Ade no Miya (the Imperial Prince Satohito, later the Emperor Reigen) hastily became the crown prince while another younger paternal half-brother Hanamachi no Miya (the Imperial Prince Nagahito) ascended the throne as the Emperor Gosai, a relay successor for the time being until Ade no Miya matured.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。his を削除、only one→only,Crown prince→crown prince と修正しました。
sen.e: The Imperial Princess Takako was the Emperor's only child and there was no crown prince, and so his younger paternal half-brother Ade no Miya (the Imperial Prince Satohito, later the Emperor Reigen) hastily became the crown prince while another younger paternal half-brother Hanamachi no Miya (the Imperial Prince Nagahito) ascended the throne as the Emperor Gosai, a relay successor for the time being until Ade no Miya matured.

sen.j: しかし孝子内親王は後光明天皇の唯一の遺児、嫡流の皇女として重んじられ、天和 (日本)3年12月（1684年1月）に親王宣下、次いで宝永5年（1708年）には一品親王に叙されている。
sen.e: However, Imperial Princess Takako was respected as the Emperor Gokomyo's only one bereaved child and the Imperial princess of the direct descendant and she received senge (imperial proclamation) for Imperial Princess in January 1684, and then conferred Ippon Shinno (the first-ranked Imperial Princess) in 1708.
sen.cmt: 親王宣下、一品親王: それぞれ女性扱いでPrinceではなくPrincessで訳しています。
sen.e: However, the Imperial Princess Takako was respected as the Emperor Gokomyo's only one bereaved child and the imperial princess of the direct descendant; she received senge (imperial proclamation) for the imperial princess in January 1684, and then conferred Ippon Shinno (the first-ranked imperial princess) in 1708.
sen.cmt: the, カンマを補いました。Imperial princess→imperial princess と修正しました。パンクチュエーションを修正しました。
sen.e: However, the Imperial Princess Takako was respected as the Emperor Gokomyo's only one bereaved child and the imperial princess of the direct descendant; she received senge (imperial proclamation) for the imperial princess in January 1684, and then conferred Ippon Shinno (the first-ranked imperial princess) in 1708.

sen.j: また孝子内親王は出家して寺社に入ることもなく、生涯独身を通した。
sen.e: She did not enter into priesthood and remained single all her life.
Also, she did not enter priesthood and remained single all her life.
sen.cmt: Also を補いました。 into を削除しました。
sen.e: Also, she did not enter priesthood and remained single all her life.

sen.j: さらに享保10年（1725年）、薨去に際しては、准后宣下、次いで女院号宣下がなされて礼成門院（れいせいもんいん）と称された。
sen.e: After her death in 1725, she also received senge for Jugo (honorary rank next to the three Empresses: Great Empress Dowager, Empress Dowager, and Empress), and later she was given Nyoingo (a title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) and called Reiseimonin.

After her death in 1725, the senge for Jugo (honorary rank next to the three empresses: great empress dowager, empress dowager, and empress), and later Nyoingo (a title of respect given to close female relatives of the emperor or a woman of comparable standing) were made, and she was named Reiseimonin.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: After her death in 1725, the senge for Jugo (honorary rank next to the three empresses: great empress dowager, empress dowager, and empress), and later Nyoingo (a title of respect given to close female relatives of the emperor or a woman of comparable standing) were made, and she was named Reiseimonin.

sen.j: 天皇の后妃、生母以外での女院号宣下は室町幕府3代将軍足利義満の正室、日野康子（北山院）以来約320年ぶりで、現在に至るまで孝子内親王が最後の例である。
sen.e: It was the first time in about 320 years that someone other than an emperor's wife or real mother received senge for Nyoingo since Yasuko HINO (Kitayamain), who was the lawful wife of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the third shogun of the Muromachi period, did so and no such cases have been recorded after Imperial Princess Takako up to the present date.

It was the first time in about 320 years that someone other than emperors' consorts or real mothers received senge for Nyoingo after Yasuko HINO (Kitayamain), who was the lawful wife of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the third Shogun of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), the Imperial Princess Takako has been the last case up to today.
sen.cmt: an emperor's wife→emperors' consorts,mother→mothers,since→after,「室町幕府3代将軍」の部分を修正しました。文最後の部分をスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: It was the first time in about 320 years that someone other than emperors' consorts or real mothers received senge for Nyoingo after Yasuko HINO (Kitayamain), who was the lawful wife of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the third Shogun of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), the Imperial Princess Takako has been the last case up to today.

sen.j: 孝子内親王は76歳の長寿を保った。
sen.e: She lived long to be 76.
She lived long to be 76.
She lived long to be 76.

sen.j: 墓所は京都市上京区の般舟院陵内。
sen.e: Her graveyard is located at Hanshuin no Misasagi in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Her graveyard is located at Hanshuin no Misasagi in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Her graveyard is located at Hanshuin no Misasagi in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
